- `speculate` has `.git` (is a git repo) ✓
- `skills-private` has `.git` (is a git repo) ✓

That's why skills-public doesn't show up in the repositories view - it's not initialized as a git repository.</details></think>

---

That's the issue: **`skills-public` is not a git repository**.

| Folder | Has `.git`? |
|--------|-------------|
| `speculate` | ✅ Yes |
| `skills-private` | ✅ Yes |
| `skills-public` | ❌ No |

The "repositories view" in Cursor/VS Code only shows folders that are actual git repositories. `skills-public` has a `.gitignore` file but was never initialized with `git init`.

To fix this, you can initialize it as a git repo:

```bash
cd /Users/kevinlin/code/skills-public && git init
```

Would you like me to run that for you?
